Drive-thru pick-up meal service for distance learners is available at all Edmond schools. On the days that students are not eating in the school cafeteria, meals will be available for pickup at all school locations. Unlike the summer meal program, meals will need to be picked up at the child’s home school because we need to confirm that they are enrolled, charge them according to their meal status at their school, and ensure that the meals are appropriate for the child’s grade level.

Children do not have to be present at pick-up, but whoever picks up the meals will need to provide the student’s name(s) to check off the roster as meals are passed out.

Site-specific times and pick-up locations: https://edmondschools.net/news/2020/district-schedules-drive-thru-pick-up-meal-service-for-distance-learners/

The District has finalized its plan for graduation. After reviewing the results of our Graduation Planning Survey, with 567 seniors participating and 960 parents, the district has scheduled graduation ceremonies for 9:00 A.M., Saturday, July 25. At that time, separate ceremonies will be held simultaneously at all three high school stadiums.

Ceremonies will be subject to the health conditions and state and local gathering directives prior to and at the time of graduation. We will continue to monitor the course of COVID-19, as well as national and local health and safety guidelines; and we are prepared to make adjustments to the ceremonies if necessary. School sites will be sending out more specifics about the individual ceremonies next week.

We greatly appreciate the feedback that has been provided by everyone involved in this process. We can’t wait for July 25 when we can honor and celebrate our seniors! https://edmondschools.net/news/2020/graduation-scheduled-for-900-a-m-july-25-at-high-school-stadiums/

post_text: The Edmond Board of Education tonight named Keith Pautler principal of Central Middle School. The leadership position at Central became open when Laura McGee resigned earlier this month to accept a position at another school district. Most recently, Pautler served as an assistant principal at Edmond Memorial High School. Prior to that, he was principal at Ida Freeman Elementary. In addition, board members also named several new elementary school assistant principals: Annisa Angier-Dunn, Shelby Rigsby, Amanda Neely, and Amanda Lonberg. They will be assigned to specific schools in June. Also tonight, Byron Gutierrez was named the new EMHS Head Girls' Soccer Coach. Congratulations to everyone!

post_text: John Ross Elementary second-graders Taylor, Adriana, and Charlotte were recently named regional winners in the National ExploraVision science competition. Their idea of TeddyCare, a customizable stuffed animal that uses artificial intelligence to monitor and track important vital signs for children with fears, phobias or illnesses, was one of 24 regional winners chosen from more than 4,000 entries nationwide. TeddyCare would detect the cause for the change in a child’s temperature, heart rate, oxygen levels or other body signals and either notify parents or make simple adjustments to calm the child. Way to go students and teacher Heidi Walter!
